TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and currently lives in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's apartment in the city of GPE , GPE , was sold by Mr O. ( the applicant 's nephew ) , who allegedly acted under a written authority issued by the applicant , to PERSON ( a private person ) . The applicant continued to live in the flat until an unknown date in DATE , when he left GPE and took up residence in GPE .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant filed a criminal complaint against Mr O. , stating that he had stolen his passport and forged his signature on the written authority to sell the apartment .
CARDINAL . On DATE an investigator of FAC of GPE ( PERSON районний відділ внутрішніх справ , hereafter “ FAC ” ) instituted criminal proceedings against Mr O. for forgery and fraud .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON sued the applicant before ORG of Odessa ( hereafter “ the ORG ” ) seeking his eviction from the apartment at issue .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed with ORG a counterclaim against PERSON seeking to have the sales contract for the flat declared null and void for fraud .

CARDINAL . On DATE an expert with ORG of ORG ( ORG області , hereafter “ the Expert Unit ” ) , in the course of the criminal investigation against Mr O. , issued an opinion in which he stated that the signature on the written authority had been executed by a person other than the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG requested from FAC a copy of the expert 's report of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held the first hearing , which was adjourned because of the failure of Mr O. ( a witness in this case ) failure to appear .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG requested ORG ( Одеський Науково-Дослідний Інститут Судових Експертиз , hereafter “ the Institute ” ) to carry out an expert examination of the applicant 's signature on the authority .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant amended his statement of claim , adding a claim for compensation for non - pecuniary damage .
CARDINAL . On DATE an expert with the ORG submitted her report , stating that there was a possibility that the authority had been signed by the applicant with a disguised handwriting .
CARDINAL . The hearing scheduled for DATE was adjourned on account of PERSON lawyer failure to appear .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant challenged the presiding judge before the President of ORG . On DATE this challenge was accepted and another judge was appointed to hear the case .

CARDINAL . Of the CARDINAL hearings listed DATE and DATE CARDINAL were adjourned due to PERSON and her lawyer 's failure to appear , and CARDINAL due to the applicant 's absence . On an unspecified date during this period the applicant 's case was transmitted from ORG to the Illichevsky District Court of Odessa ( hereafter “ ORG ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to suspend the proceedings pending the outcome of the criminal proceedings against Mr O. The applicant appealed against this decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( hereafter “ the Regional Court ” ) found that the appeal had been lodged out of time and invited ORG to determine the admissibility of the applicant 's appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the applicant leave to appeal out of time .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the applicant 's appeal , quashed the decision of DATE and ordered a different judge of ORG to examine the merits of the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE an expert of ORG , following an additional examination carried out as a part of the criminal investigation , found that the signature on the authority form had not been made by the applicant .
CARDINAL . NORP The proceedings before ORG resumed on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , following a request of PERSON , ordered a further expert examination of the signature .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Institute informed ORG that the examination could not be carried out as PERSON had failed to pay the expert 's fee .

CARDINAL . The proceedings resumed on DATE , but were adjourned due to the applicant 's and his lawyer 's absence . As the applicant failed to appear for the hearings scheduled for CARDINAL and DATE , on the latter date ORG dismissed his claims and , noting that PERSON had withdrawn her eviction action as by that time the applicant had moved out of the disputed flat ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , discontinued the proceedings . The applicant filed an appeal against this decision and asked for leave to appeal out of time .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the applicant leave to appeal out of time .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the applicant 's appeal and ordered that the proceedings before the first instance court be continued .

CARDINAL . The proceedings resumed on DATE . The applicant asked ORG to hear his case in his absence . The court decided that the applicant 's presence was indispensable for the determination of the case and adjourned the proceedings until DATE .

CARDINAL . Between DATE and DATE the ORG fixed CARDINAL hearings , CARDINAL of which was cancelled due to the applicant 's lawyer 's failure to appear . During this period the applicant 's lawyer made CARDINAL unsuccessful challenges to the impartiality of the presiding judge .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , basing its reasoning principally on the expert 's report of DATE , rejected the applicant 's claim as unsubstantiated . The applicant appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of ORG ( hereafter “ the ORG ” ) granted the applicant 's appeal and quashed the judgment of CARDINAL DATE , holding that ORG had failed to attach due weight to the evidence collected in the course of criminal investigation against Mr O. and had overestimated the importance of the expert 's report of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the President of ORG lodged a protest ( an extraordinary appeal ) with the Presidium of ORG ( hereafter “ the ORG ” ) against the ruling of CARDINAL DATE . He considered that the judgment of CARDINAL DATE had been quashed by the ORG unreasonably and that the first instance court had correctly established the relevant facts , and had given cogent reasons for its decision .

CARDINAL . The protest was examined on DATE by the ORG under the chairmanship of the President of ORG . Having accepted the reasons set out in the protest , the ORG quashed the ruling of CARDINAL DATE and upheld the judgment of CARDINAL DATE , which became final and binding immediately . Neither the applicant nor his representative was invited to comment upon the protest or to participate in the hearing before the ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the decision of the ORG , together with the case - file , was sent to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant sent a letter to ORG requesting it to account for the delay in the proceedings . On DATE ORG informed the applicant about its ORG 's decision and sent him a copy .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal against the decision of DATE under the new cassation procedure .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided not to deal with the appeal because the applicant had failed to meet the relevant procedural requirements , namely clearly to specify which law he alleged to have been breached by the lower courts and in what way .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG adjourned consideration of the applicant 's cassation appeal and suggested that he remedy its shortcomings by DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's cassation appeal because he had failed to comply with the relevant procedural requirements .
CARDINAL . The outcome of the criminal proceedings against Mr O. is unknown .

CARDINAL .
